t: Jeremiah 31
“At*p that time,” declares the Lord,*s “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.”
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “The*pn people who survive the sword will*ld find favor in the wilderness; I*ld will come to give rest to Israel.”
The*p Lord*s appeared to us in the past, saying: “I*pn have loved you with an everlasting love; I*ld have drawn you with unfailing kindness.
I*ln will build you up again, and*ld you, Virgin Israel, will be rebuilt. Again*ln you will take up your timbrels and*ld go out to dance with the joyful.
Again*ln you will plant vineyards on*ld the hills of Samaria; the*ln farmers will plant them and*ld enjoy their fruit.
There*ln will be a day when watchmen cry out on*ld the hills of Ephraim, ‘Come,*ln let us go up to Zion, to*ld the Lord*s our God.’ ”
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Sing*pn with joy for Jacob; shout*ld for the foremost of the nations. Make*ln your praises heard, and say, ‘Lord,*sld save your people, the*ld remnant of Israel.’

See,*ln I will bring them from the land of the north and*ld gather them from the ends of the earth. Among*ln them will be the blind and the lame, expectant*ld mothers and women in labor; a*ld great throng will return.

They*ln will come with weeping; they*ld will pray as I bring them back. I*ln will lead them beside streams of water on*ld a level path where they will not stumble, because*ln I am Israel’s father, and*ld Ephraim is my firstborn son.
“Hear*pn the word of the Lord,*s you nations; proclaim*ld it in distant coastlands: ‘He*ln who scattered Israel will gather them and*ld will watch over his flock like a shepherd.’
For*ln the Lord*s will deliver Jacob and*ld redeem them from the hand of those stronger than they.

They*ln will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion; they*ld will rejoice in the bounty of the Lord—*s the*ln grain, the new wine and the olive oil, the*ld young of the flocks and herds. They*ln will be like a well-watered garden, and*ld they will sorrow no more.
Then*ln young women will dance and be glad, young*ld men and old as well. I*ln will turn their mourning into gladness; I*ld will give them comfort and joy instead of sorrow.
I*ln will satisfy the priests with abundance, and*ld my people will be filled with my bounty,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “A*pn voice is heard in Ramah, mourning*ld and great weeping, Rachel*ln weeping for her children and*ld refusing to be comforted, because*ld they are no more.”

This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Restrain*pn your voice from weeping and*ld your eyes from tears, for*ln your work will be rewarded,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “They*ld will return from the land of the enemy.
So*ln there is hope for your descendants,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “Your*ld children will return to their own land.
“I*pn have surely heard Ephraim’s moaning: ‘You*ld disciplined me like an unruly calf, and*ld I have been disciplined. Restore*ln me, and I will return, because*ld you are the Lord*s my God.
After*ln I strayed, I*ld repented; after*ln I came to understand, I*ld beat my breast. I*ln was ashamed and humiliated because*ld I bore the disgrace of my youth.’

Is*ln not Ephraim my dear son, the*ld child in whom I delight? Though*ln I often speak against him, I*ld still remember him. Therefore*ln my heart yearns for him; I*ld have great compassion for him,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“Set*pn up road signs; put*ld up guideposts. Take*ln note of the highway, the*ld road that you take. Return,*ln Virgin Israel, return*ld to your towns.
How*ln long will you wander, unfaithful*ld Daughter Israel? The*ln Lord*s will create a new thing on earth— the*ld woman will return to the man.”

This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “When I bring them back from captivity, the people in the land of Judah and in its towns will once again use these words: ‘The Lord*s bless you, you prosperous city, you sacred mountain.’
People will live together in Judah and all its towns—farmers and those who move about with their flocks.
I will refresh the weary and satisfy the faint.”
At*p this I awoke and looked around. My sleep had been pleasant to me.
“The*p days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “when I will plant the kingdoms of Israel and Judah with the offspring of people and of animals.
Just as I watched over them to uproot and tear down, and to overthrow, destroy and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” declares the Lord.*s
“In those days people will no longer say, ‘The*pn parents have eaten sour grapes, and*ld the children’s teeth are set on edge.’
Instead,*p everyone will die for their own sin; whoever eats sour grapes—their own teeth will be set on edge.
“The*pn days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “when*ld I will make a new covenant with*ln the people of Israel and*ld with the people of Judah.

It*ln will not be like the covenant I*ld made with their ancestors when*ln I took them by the hand to*ld lead them out of Egypt, because*ln they broke my covenant, though*ld I was a husband to them,” declares*ld the Lord.*s

“This*pn is the covenant I will make with the people of Israel after*ld that time,” declares the Lord.*s “I*ln will put my law in their minds and*ld write it on their hearts. I*ln will be their God, and*ld they will be my people.

No*ln longer will they teach their neighbor, or*ld say to one another, ‘Know the Lord,’*s because*ln they will all know me, from*ld the least of them to the greatest,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “For*pn I will forgive their wickedness and*ld will remember their sins no more.”

This*p is what the Lord*s says, he*pn who appoints the sun to*ld shine by day, who*ln decrees the moon and stars to*ld shine by night, who*ln stirs up the sea so*ld that its waves roar— the*ld Lord*s Almighty is his name:
“Only*ln if these decrees vanish from my sight,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “will*ln Israel ever cease being*ld a nation before me.”

This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Only*pn if the heavens above can be measured and*ld the foundations of the earth below be searched out will*ln I reject all the descendants of Israel because*ld of all they have done,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“The*p days are coming,” declares the Lord,*s “when this city will be rebuilt for me from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
The measuring line will stretch from there straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn to Goah.

The whole valley where dead bodies and ashes are thrown, and all the terraces out to the Kidron Valley on the east as far as the corner of the Horse Gate, will be holy to the Lord.*s The city will never again be uprooted or demolished.”
